creator: annie.hamel@cgi-ams.com
text:
I am trying to make Apache with the mod_dav module. We are running a Solaris 9 
server. I read in the documentation that I also need the mod_dav_fs module. 
I took the tar file from http://httpd.apache.org/download.cgi page (Unix 
source, httpd-2.0.55.tar.gz)

I have successfully ran my configure with the command: CC="cc" CFLAGS="-
xildoff" ./configure --prefix=/usr/local/apache_2055 --enable-rewrite=shared --
enable-proxy=shared --enable-cgi=shared --enable-so=yes --enable-dav=shared --
enable-dav-fs

When I run make, I get undefined symbols errors and the make does not complete.
I discovered this problem last week using Apache-2.0.54 and following the bug 
page guidelines tried to resolve it first by installing 2.0.55
I also get the same errors if I configure with --with-dav --enable-dav-fs and 
I also get errors of the same nature if I do not specify -xildoff.
Please let me know if you need the full log of the configure call or the make 
call, I have them but could not attach them here because they are too long.

Errors received:

make[2]: Leaving directory `/usr/httpd-2.0.55/support'
make[1]: Leaving directory `/usr/httpd-2.0.55/support'

ld: fatal: Symbol referencing errors. No output written to .libs/httpd
make[1]: *** [httpd] Error 1
make[1]: Leaving directory `/usr/httpd-2.0.55'
make: *** [all-recursive] Error 1

Have you tried CC="cc" CFLAGS="-xildoff" ./configure
--prefix=/usr/local/apache_2055 --enable-rewrite=shared --enable-proxy=shared
--enable-cgi=shared --enable-so=yes --enable-dav=shared --enable-dav-fs=shared

(I exchanged --enable-dav-fs against --enable-dav-fs=shared)?

It seems to be that mod_dav gets build as shared object whereas mod_dav_fs seems
to get build static. This does not work.
creator: rpluem@apache.org
annie.hamel@cgi-ams.com
text:
I had not seen this specified anywhere on the web, but when I tried it Apache 
2.0.55 compiled successfully. I now have to see if it will actually work, but 
at least I'm over the compile error.

THANKS!!!!!!!!!
